item.title: 多诺霍警告：医药关税可能使爱尔兰失去 7.5 万个工作岗位
item.description: 爱尔兰财政部长帕夏尔-多诺霍（Paschal Donohoe）警告说，爱尔兰是辉瑞公司（Pfizer Inc.）和礼来公司（Eli Lilly & Co.【原文：Tariffs on pharmaceuticals could cost Ireland — a multinational hub for the likes of Pfizer Inc. and Eli Lilly & Co. — up to 75,000 jobs, Finance Minister Paschal Donohoe warned.】

item.title: 科威特开始动员银行出售 60 亿美元债券
item.description: 据科威特财政部官员称，科威特已开始向银行发出建议书，以从国际债务市场筹集约 60 亿美元。【原文：Kuwait has started the process of sending a request for proposal to banks to raise about $6 billion from international debt markets, according to Ministry of Finance officials.】

item.title: Agnico Eagle 首席执行官认为购买黄金股的理由只有一个
item.description: 世界上最有价值的金矿公司之一的负责人认为，购买金矿股票只有一个理由—；而该行业中为投资者提供这个理由的公司太少了。【原文：The head of one of the world’s most valuable gold miners believes there’s only one reason to buy a gold mining stock — and too few companies in the industry are offering it to investors.】

item.title: 年轻投资者对另类资产的需求正在重塑华尔街的游戏规则
item.description: 华尔街有了新宠投资者。他们年轻、富裕，对传统市场能否带来长期财富持怀疑态度。在金融危机的影响下，在科技乐观主义的推动下，千禧一代和 Z 世代这个富裕阶层正在将资金转移到另类资产的热闹世界中。【原文：Wall Street has a new favorite investor. They’re young, they’re affluent and they’re skeptical that traditional markets can deliver wealth over the long haul. Shaped by financial crises and fueled by tech optimism, this well-heeled class of Millennials and Gen Z are moving their money into the buzzy world of alternative assets.】

item.title: 对冲基金高管瞄准 1 亿美元积累 BNB 代币
item.description: 一个加密货币对冲基金高管团队正在进行高级谈判，以筹集 1 亿美元资金，通过他们控制的一家上市公司投资于与 Binance 控股有限公司相关联的代币，这是迈克尔-赛勒（Michael Saylor）的策略公司（Strategy）开创的比特币财政蓝图的最新发展。【原文：A team of crypto hedge fund executives are in advanced talks to raise $100 million for investing in a token linked to Binance Holdings Ltd. through a publicly listed company they control, in the latest spin on the Bitcoin treasury blueprint pioneered by Michael Saylor’s Strategy.】

item.title: 美国防备伊朗空袭后的 "低级 "网络攻击
item.description: 美国官员警告企业做好准备，应对美国空袭伊朗核场址后可能发生的伊朗网络攻击。【原文：US officials are warning businesses to brace for potential Iranian cyberattacks following American airstrikes on the country’s nuclear sites, an event that experts say could draw a relatively small response from hackers.】

item.title: 中东局势升级引发通胀风险，美元大涨
item.description: 由于美国对伊朗的打击刺激了对避险货币的需求，同时凸显了油价攀升带来的风险，美元升至近一个月来的最高水平。【原文：The dollar rose to the highest level in nearly a month as US strikes on Iran spurred demand for the haven currency while underscoring the risks posed by climbing oil prices.】

item.description:
在短暂飙升之后，原油期货周一收窄涨幅，延续了整个冲突期间的冷淡趋势。【原文：

item.title: 债券交易员从美联储官员身上寻找降息时机的线索
item.description: 债券投资者正密切关注美联储官员在最近一次政策会议上预计的 2025 年两次降息的暗示。【原文：Bond investors are on alert for hints on when the Federal Reserve will deliver the two 2025 interest-rate cuts officials projected at their latest policy meeting.】

item.title: 以色列继续攻击伊朗，关于何时停止的争论不绝于耳
item.description: 在美国于周末对伊朗实施打击后，以色列战机继续对伊朗导弹系统、机场和福尔道核基地发动攻击，而伊朗国内则就这场攻击行动应持续多久展开了激烈辩论。【原文：Israeli warplanes kept up their attacks on Iranian missiles systems, airfields and the Fordow nuclear site following US strikes at the weekend, as debate raged in the country over how long the campaign should continue.】

item.title: F1 "背后的资金支持：苹果搅局科技界的 "一级方程式 "派对
item.description: 欢迎阅读 Tech In Depth，这是我们的每日时事通讯，由彭博社全球记者提供有关科技商业的报道和分析。今天，奥斯汀-卡尔（Austin Carr）将报道科技行业与一级方程式赛车的品牌合作，包括苹果公司对本周晚些时候上映的一部新电影的支持。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. item.description: 我是克里斯-安斯蒂，波士顿的经济编辑。今天我们将探讨破坏全球经济扩张的最新威胁。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net。如果您还没有注册，请点击这里。【原文：I’m Chris Anstey, an economics editor in Boston. item.title: 摩根士丹利为中间市场交易募集 32 亿美元资金
item.description: 摩根士丹利资本合伙公司（Morgan Stanley Capital Partners）专注于中型市场，在私募股权公司筹资市场艰难的情况下，为其最新的收购基金募集了 32 亿美元。【原文：Middle-market focused Morgan Stanley Capital Partners has collected $3.2 billion for its latest buyout fund amid a tough fundraising market for private equity firms.】

item.title: 安哥拉总统敦促美国公司投资石油和矿产以外的领域
item.description: 安哥拉总统若昂-卢伦科呼吁美国公司扩大在非洲的投资，从传统的石油和矿产开采业扩展到汽车、造船、旅游、水泥和钢铁等行业。【原文：Angolan President Joao Lourenco called on US companies to expand their investments in Africa beyond traditional oil and mineral extraction to industries such as automobiles, shipbuilding, tourism, cement and steel.】

item.title: 特拉菲古拉镍业噩梦中的主要交易商加入阿布扎比 IRH
item.description: 阿布扎比的国际资源控股公司（International Resources Holding）聘请了前 Trafigura 集团交易员哈什德普-巴蒂亚（Harshdeep Bhatia），他曾领导该公司与被指控对其实施大规模镍欺诈的人的关系。【原文：Abu Dhabi’s International Resources Holding has hired Harshdeep Bhatia, a former Trafigura Group trader who led the company’s relationship with the man it accuses of perpetrating a massive nickel fraud against it.】

item.title: 据称三家中国公司将参与苏伊士资产的下一轮竞标
item.description: 据知情人士透露，中国国有企业北京首都创业集团有限公司、中国建筑工程总公司和粤海控股有限公司是苏伊士集团中国水务基础设施资产的竞标者之一。【原文：Chinese state-owned firms Beijing Capital Group Co., China State Construction Engineering Corp. and Guangdong Holdings Ltd. are among bidders for Suez SA’s Chinese water infrastructure assets, according to people familiar with the situation.】

item.title: 据说华平正在商谈出售 SBI 通用保险股份
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，华平投资集团正在与普瑞姆吉投资公司和印度国家银行商谈出售其持有的 SBI 通用保险公司约 10% 的股份。【原文：Warburg Pincus is in talks with Premji Invest and State Bank of India about selling them its stake of about 10% in SBI General Insurance Co., according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 石油引发通胀担忧，欧洲引领全球债券大跌
item.description: 由于中东冲突升级加剧了人们对石油供应中断将引发通货膨胀的担忧，欧洲引领了全球债券大跌。【原文：Europe led a global bond selloff as the escalating conflict in the Middle East stoked fears of an oil supply disruption that would fan inflation.】

item.title: 顶级银行家称波动性 "彻底改变 "了咖啡和可可贸易
item.description: 据咖啡和可可行业的一位顶级银行家称，随着咖啡和可可贸易公司通过放弃长期交易来适应更高和更不稳定的价格，几十年来咖啡和可可贸易的商业模式已被颠覆。【原文：Decades-old business models for coffee and cocoa trading have been upended as firms adapt to higher and more volatile prices by moving away from longer-term trades, according to one of the industry’s top bankers.】

item.title: 阿曼计划对高收入者征收所得税，这在海湾国家中尚属首次
item.description: 阿曼宣布了征收所得税的计划，成为第一个征收所得税的海湾国家，以扩大石油以外的公共收入来源。【原文：Oman has announced plans to impose income tax, becoming the first Gulf state to do so in an effort to broaden its sources of public revenue beyond oil.】

item.title: 5 月份中国太阳能新增装机量在截止日期前飙升至创纪录水平
item.description: 中国的太阳能发电装机量在 5 月份激增，创下了新的月度纪录，因为各公司都赶在新规定开始实施之前完成项目，而新规定有可能会降低可再生能源发电的价格。【原文：China’s solar installations surged in May, setting a new monthly record as companies rushed to finish projects before the start of new rules that threaten to slash renewable power prices.】

item.title: 美国清洁能源项目取消对共和党选区打击最大
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普总统执政期间，由于税收优惠政策的倒退和政策的不确定性，美国的清洁能源投资正在迅速萎缩，其中共和党地区受到的冲击最大。【原文：Clean energy investments in the US are shrinking fast amid the rollback of tax incentives and policy uncertainties under President Donald Trump’s administration, with Republican districts hardest hit.】

item.title: 日本批准将本财年超长期债券销售额削减 220 亿美元的计划
item.description: 日本将从 7 月开始减少超长期债券的发行量，以平息因近期收益率飙升而惶恐不安的债券市场。【原文：Japan will reduce its issuance of super-long bonds starting in July, taking a step to calm a bond market rattled by recent surges in yields.】

item.title: 纽约喷气机队老板伍迪-约翰逊同意水晶宫股份交易
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，纽约喷气机队的共同所有人、前美国驻英国大使罗伯特-"伍迪"-约翰逊四世（Robert "Woody" Johnson IV）已同意购买最近的足总杯冠军水晶宫队的大量股份。【原文：Robert “Woody” Johnson IV, the co-owner of the New York Jets and a former American ambassador to the UK, has agreed to buy a significant stake in Crystal Palace, the most recent FA Cup champion, according to people familiar with the situation.】

item.title: 英国私营部门以特朗普关税以来最快速度增长
item.description: 一项受到密切关注的调查显示，英国私营部门 6 月份的扩张速度略有加快，有助于缓解人们对第二季度经济萎缩的担忧。【原文：The UK private sector expanded at a marginally faster pace in June, helping ease worries of an economic contraction in the second quarter, according to a closely watched survey.】
